verses.roman:
'āmi--baḍa ojhā jāni bhūta chāḍāite'
mantra paḍi' śrī-hasta dilā tāhāra māthāte

synonyms: āmi—I; baḍa—big; ojhā—exorcist; jāni—I know; bhūta—ghost; chāḍāite—how to exorcise; mantra paḍi'-chanting hymns; śrī-hasta—his hand; dilā—placed; tāhāra māthāte—on his head.
translation: "I am a famous exorcist," he said, "and I know how to rid you of this ghost." He then chanted some mantras and placed his hand on the top of the fisherman's head.
